Java SEä¸­çš„ AWT å’Œ Swing åŒ…çš„è®¾è®¡å°±åŸºäºç»„åˆæ¨¡å¼,åœ¨è¿™äº›ç•Œé¢åŒ…ä¸­ä¸ºç”¨æˆ·æä¾›äº†å¤§é‡çš„å®¹å™¨æ„ä»¶,å¦‚ Container( å®¹å™¨æ„ä»¶ ) å’Œæˆå‘˜æ„ä»¶,å¦‚ Checkbox, Button, TextComponent( ä¸€äº›å¶å­æ„ä»¶ )ç­‰,å…¶éƒ½ç»§æ‰¿è‡ª Componet æŠ½è±¡ç±»( æŠ½è±¡æ„ä»¶ )

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº1

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨ç»„åˆè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼çš„ç®€å•ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº,è¿™æ®µç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºçš„åŠŸèƒ½ä¸ºåˆ—å‡ºæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹åŠå…¶ä¸­æ–‡ä»¶çš„åç§°åŠå¤§å°~

  1. EntryæŠ½è±¡ç±» : è¡¨ç¤ºç›®å½•æ¡ç›®çš„æŠ½è±¡ç±», å……å½“Componentè§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: è¡¨ç¤ºç›®å½•æ¡ç›®çš„æŠ½è±¡ç±», å……å½“Componentè§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:16 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class Entry {    public abstract String getName();    public abstract int getSize();    public Entry add(Entry entry) throws FileTreatMentException {        throw new FileTreatMentException();    }    public void printList() {        printList("");    }    protected abstract void printList(String prefix);    public String toString() {        return getName() + " (" + getSize() + ")";    }}

  2. Fileç±» : è¡¨ç¤ºæ–‡ä»¶çš„ç±», å……å½“Leafè§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: è¡¨ç¤ºæ–‡ä»¶çš„ç±», å……å½“Leafè§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:22 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class File extends Entry {    private String name;    private int size;    public File(String name, int size) {        this.name = name;        this.size = size;    }    @Override    public String getName() {        return name;    }    @Override    public int getSize() {        return size;    }    @Override    protected void printList(String prefix) {        System.out.println(prefix + "/" + this.toString());    }}

  3. Directoryç±» : è¡¨ç¤ºæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹çš„ç±», å……å½“Compositeè§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_1;import java.util.ArrayList;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: è¡¨ç¤ºæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹çš„ç±», å……å½“Compositeè§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:25 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Directory extends Entry {    private String name;    private ArrayList<Entry> directory = new ArrayList<>();    public Directory(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    @Override    public String getName() {        return name;    }    @Override    public int getSize() {        var size = 0;        for (Entry entry : directory) {            size += entry.getSize();        }        return size;    }    @Override    public Entry add(Entry entry) {        directory.add(entry);        return this;    }    @Override    protected void printList(String prefix) {        System.out.println(prefix + "/" + this.toString());        for (Entry entry : directory) {            entry.printList(prefix + "/" + name);        }    }}

  4. FileTreatMentExceptionç±» : è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¼‚å¸¸ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¼‚å¸¸ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:19 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class FileTreatMentException extends RuntimeException {    public FileTreatMentException() {    }    public FileTreatMentException(String msg) {        super(msg);    }}

  5. Clientç±» : å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æµ‹è¯•ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æµ‹è¯•ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:36 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Client {    public static void main(String[] args) {        try {            System.out.println("------ Making Root Entries ------");            Directory rootdir = new Directory("root");            Directory bindir = new Directory("bin");            Directory temdir = new Directory("tmp");            Directory usrdir = new Directory("usr");            rootdir.add(bindir);            rootdir.add(temdir);            rootdir.add(usrdir);            bindir.add(new File("demo1.class", 10000));            bindir.add(new File("demo2.class", 20000));            rootdir.printList();            System.out.println("\n" + "------ Making User Entries ------");            Directory demoDir1 = new Directory("demoDir1");            Directory demoDir2 = new Directory("demoDir2");            Directory demoDir3 = new Directory("demoDir3");            usrdir.add(demoDir1);            usrdir.add(demoDir2);            usrdir.add(demoDir3);            demoDir1.add(new File("demo.html", 100));            demoDir1.add(new File("demo.java", 200));            demoDir2.add(new File("demo.txt", 300));            demoDir3.add(new File("demo.doc", 400));            demoDir3.add(new File("demo.mail", 500));            rootdir.printList();        } catch (FileTreatMentException e) {            e.printStackTrace();        }    }}

  6. ç¨‹åºè¿è¡Œç»“æœå¦‚ä¸‹æ‰€ç¤º :

    ------ Making Root Entries ------/root (30000)/root/bin (30000)/root/bin/demo1.class (10000)/root/bin/demo2.class (20000)/root/tmp (0)/root/usr (0)------ Making User Entries ------/root (31500)/root/bin (30000)/root/bin/demo1.class (10000)/root/bin/demo2.class (20000)/root/tmp (0)/root/usr (1500)/root/usr/demoDir1 (300)/root/usr/demoDir1/demo.html (100)/root/usr/demoDir1/demo.java (200)/root/usr/demoDir2 (300)/root/usr/demoDir2/demo.txt (300)/root/usr/demoDir3 (900)/root/usr/demoDir3/demo.doc (400)/root/usr/demoDir3/demo.mail (500)

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºçš„ç±»å›¾

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº2

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨ç»„åˆè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼çš„ç®€å•ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº : å†™ä¸€ä¸ªæ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ€æ¯’( Antivirus )ç¨‹åº,è¯¥ç¨‹åºæ—¢å¯ä»¥å¯¹æŸä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶å¤¹( Folder )æ€æ¯’,ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥å¯¹æŸä¸ªæŒ‡å®šçš„æ–‡ä»¶( File )æ€æ¯’,è€Œä¸”è¯¥æ€æ¯’ç¨‹åºè¿˜å¯ä»¥æ ¹æ®å„ç±»æ–‡ä»¶çš„ç‰¹ç‚¹ä¸ºä¸åŒç±»å‹(æ–‡æœ¬æ–‡ä»¶,å›¾åƒæ–‡ä»¶,éŸ³é¢‘æ–‡ä»¶ç­‰)çš„æ–‡ä»¶æä¾›ä¸åŒçš„æ€æ¯’æ–¹å¼.

  1. AbstractFileæŠ½è±¡ç±» : æŠ½è±¡æ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“æŠ½è±¡æ„ä»¶ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æŠ½è±¡æ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“æŠ½è±¡æ„ä»¶ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-1:19 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class AbstractFile {    public abstract String getName();    public abstract void killVirus();    public void add(AbstractFile file) {        throw new FileTreatMentException();    }}

  2. TextFileç±» : æ–‡æœ¬æ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“å¶å­æ„ä»¶ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æ–‡æœ¬æ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“å¶å­æ„ä»¶ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-1:31 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class TextFile extends AbstractFile {    private String name;    public TextFile(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    @Override    public String getName() {        return name;    }    @Override    public void killVirus() {        System.out.println("â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”> å¯¹æ–‡æœ¬æ–‡ä»¶[ " + name + " ]è¿›è¡Œæ€æ¯’");    }}

  3. ImageFileç±» : å›¾åƒæ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“å¶å­æ„ä»¶ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å›¾åƒæ–‡ä»¶ç±», å……å½“å¶å­æ„ä»¶ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-1:27 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class ImageFile extends AbstractFile {    private String name;    public ImageFile(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    @Override    public String getName() {        return name;    }    @Override    public void killVirus() {        System.out.println("â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”> å¯¹å›¾åƒæ–‡ä»¶[ " + name + " ]è¿›è¡Œæ€æ¯’");    }}

  4. Folderç±» : æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ç±», å……å½“å®¹å™¨æ„ä»¶ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;import java.util.ArrayList;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ç±», å……å½“å®¹å™¨æ„ä»¶ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-1:38 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Folder extends AbstractFile {    private String name;    private ArrayList<AbstractFile> directory = new ArrayList<>();    public Folder(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    @Override    public String getName() {        return name;    }    @Override    public void add(AbstractFile file) {        directory.add(file);    }    @Override    public void killVirus() {        System.out.println("======> å¯¹æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹[ " + name + " ]è¿›è¡Œæ€æ¯’");        //é€’å½’è°ƒç”¨æˆå‘˜æ„ä»¶çš„killVirusæ–¹æ³•        for (AbstractFile abstractFile : directory) {            abstractFile.killVirus();        }    }}

  5. FileTreatMentExceptionç±» : è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¼‚å¸¸ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¼‚å¸¸ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-12:19 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class FileTreatMentException extends RuntimeException {    public FileTreatMentException() {    }    public FileTreatMentException(String msg) {        super(msg);    }}

  6. Clientç±» : å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æµ‹è¯•ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.composite_pattern.composite_pattern_2;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å®¢æˆ·ç«¯æµ‹è¯•ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/11/2019-1:44 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Client {    public static void main(String[] args) {        AbstractFile folder = new Folder("my-folder");        AbstractFile textFolder = new Folder("text-folder");        AbstractFile imageFolder = new Folder("image-folder");        AbstractFile file = new TextFile("demo.text");        AbstractFile image = new ImageFile("demo.jpg");        textFolder.add(file);        imageFolder.add(image);        folder.add(textFolder);        folder.add(imageFolder);        folder.killVirus();    }}

  7. ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºçš„è¿è¡Œç»“æœå¦‚ä¸‹æ‰€ç¤º :

    package pers.huangyuhui.decorator_pattern;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æ„ä»¶è£…é¥°ç±», å……å½“æŠ½è±¡è£…é¥°ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/9/2019-2:52 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class ComponentDecorator extends Component {    //ç»´æŒå¯¹æŠ½è±¡æ„ä»¶ç±»å‹å¯¹è±¡çš„å¼•ç”¨    private Component component;    //æ³¨å…¥æŠ½è±¡æ„ä»¶ç±»å‹çš„å¯¹è±¡    public ComponentDecorator(Component component) {        this.component = component;    }    @Override    public void display() {        component.display();    }}

å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®° : Javaè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼ä¹‹Singleton Pattern

æ¦‚å¿µ

å•ä¾‹è®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼ : ç¡®ä¿ä¸€ä¸ªç±»åªèƒ½æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå®ä¾‹,å¹¶æä¾›ä¸€ä¸ªå…¨å±€è®¿é—®ç‚¹æ¥è®¿é—®è¿™ä¸ªå®ä¾‹. (Singleton Pattern : Ensure a class has only one intance,and provide a global point of access to it. ). å•ä¾‹è®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼æ˜¯ä¸€ç§å¯¹è±¡åˆ›å»ºå‹æ¨¡å¼,å…¶ä¸»è¦æœ‰ä¸‰ä¸ªè¦ç‚¹ :

  1. æŸä¸ªç±»åªèƒ½æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªå®ä¾‹
  2. å¿…é¡»è‡ªè¡Œåˆ›å»ºè¿™ä¸ªå®ä¾‹

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº-é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹

é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ç±»( Eager Singleton )æ˜¯æœ€ç®€å•çš„å•ä¾‹ç±»,æ—¢ç±»è¢«åŠ è½½æ—¶é™æ€å˜é‡ instance å°±ä¼šè¢«åˆå§‹åŒ–,ç¨‹åºç¤ºä¾‹å¦‚ä¸‹æ‰€ç¤º :

package pers.huangyuhui.singleton_pattern.eager_singleton;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼-é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/6/2019-10:44 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class EagerSingleton {    private static final EagerSingleton instance = new EagerSingleton();    private EagerSingleton() {    }    public static EagerSingleton getInstance() {        return instance;    }}

æ³¨ : ä»èµ„æºåˆ©ç”¨æ•ˆç‡çš„è§’åº¦æ¥è®²é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ä¸åŠæ‡’æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹,è€Œä¸”ç³»ç»ŸåŠ è½½æ—¶ç”±äºéœ€è¦åˆ›å»ºé¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹å¯¹è±¡,åŠ è½½æ—¶é—´å¯èƒ½æ¯”è¾ƒé•¿.

ä¸é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ä¸åŒçš„æ˜¯,æ‡’æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ç±»( Lazy Singleton )åœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡è¢«å¼•ç”¨æ—¶æ‰ä¼šå°†è‡ªå·±å®ä¾‹åŒ–,å½“å•ä¾‹ç±»è¢«åŠ è½½æ—¶å¹¶ä¸ä¼šå°†è‡ªå·±å®ä¾‹åŒ–, ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºå¦‚ä¸‹æ‰€ç¤º :

package pers.huangyuhui.singleton_pattern.lazy_singleton;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼-æ‡’æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/6/2019-10:50 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class LazySingleton {    //è¢«volatileä¿®é¥°çš„æˆå‘˜å˜é‡å¯ä»¥ç¡®ä¿å¤šä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹éƒ½èƒ½å¤Ÿæ­£ç¡®å¤„ç†    private volatile static LazySingleton instance = null;    private LazySingleton() {    }    public static LazySingleton getInstance() {        //ç¬¬ä¸€é‡åˆ¤æ–­        if (instance == null) {            //é”å®šä»£ç å—:ç¡®ä¿ä»»ä½•æ—¶åˆ»åªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å¯æ‰§è¡Œæ­¤ä»£ç å—            synchronized (LazySingleton.class) {                //ç¬¬äºŒé‡åˆ¤æ–­:é˜²æ­¢äº§ç”Ÿå¤šä¸ªå•ä¾‹å¯¹è±¡                if (instance == null) {                    instance = new LazySingleton();                }            }        }        return instance;    }}

æ³¨ : ç”±äºvolatileå…³é”®å­—ä¼šå±è”½Javaè™šæ‹Ÿæœºæ‰€åšçš„ä¸€åˆ‡ä»£ç ä¼˜åŒ–,ç»§è€Œå¯èƒ½ä¼šå¯¼è‡´ç³»ç»Ÿçš„è¿è¡Œæ•ˆç‡é™ä½,å› æ­¤å³ä½¿ä½¿ç”¨åŒé‡æ£€æŸ¥é”å®šæ¥å®ç°å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼ä¹Ÿä¸æ˜¯ä¸€ç§å®Œç¾çš„å®ç°æ–¹æ³•å“Ÿ~

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº-å†…éƒ¨ç±»å®ç°å•ä¾‹

é¥¿æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ä¸èƒ½å®ç°å»¶è¿ŸåŠ è½½,ä¸ç®¡å°†æ¥ç”¨ä¸ç”¨å§‹ç»ˆå æ®å†…å­˜. æ‡’æ±‰å¼å•ä¾‹ç±»çº¿ç¨‹å®‰å…¨æ§åˆ¶ç¹ç,è€Œä¸”æ€§èƒ½å—å½±å“. ä¸ºäº†å…‹æœè¿™äº›é—®é¢˜,åœ¨Javaè¯­è¨€ä¸­å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡ä½¿ç”¨ Initialization on Demand Holder( IoDH )æŠ€æœ¯æ¥å®ç°å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼,ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºå¦‚ä¸‹æ‰€ç¤º :

package pers.huangyuhui.singleton_pattern.IoDH_singleton;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼-å†…éƒ¨ç±»å®ç°å•ä¾‹ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/6/2019-11:11 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Singleton {    private Singleton() {    }    //é™æ€å†…éƒ¨ç±»    public static class HolderClass {        private final static Singleton instance = new Singleton();    }    public static Singleton getInstance() {        return HolderClass.instance;    }}

æ³¨ : é€šè¿‡ä½¿ç”¨IoDHæ—¢å¯ä»¥å®ç°å»¶è¿ŸåŠ è½½,åˆå¯ä»¥ä¿è¯çº¿ç¨‹å®‰å…¨,ä¸å½±å“ç³»ç»Ÿæ€§èƒ½,æ—¢å…¶ä¸ºä¸€ç§æœ€å¥½çš„Javaè¯­è¨€å•ä¾‹æ¨¡å¼å®ç°æ–¹å¼,å…¶ç¼ºç‚¹ä¸ºå¾ˆå¤šé¢å‘å¯¹è±¡è¯­è¨€å¹¶ä¸æ”¯æŒIoDHå“Ÿ~

ç®€å•å·¥å‚æ¨¡å¼( Simple Factory Pattern) : å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªå·¥å‚ç±»,ä»–å¯ä»¥æ ¹æ®å‚æ•°çš„ä¸åŒè¿”å›ä¸åŒç±»çš„å®ä¾‹,è¢«åˆ›å»ºçš„å®ä¾‹é€šå¸¸éƒ½å…·æœ‰å…±åŒçš„çˆ¶ç±». å…¶æ˜¯ä¸€ç§åˆ›å»ºå‹æ¨¡å¼,éœ€æ³¨æ„ : ç®€å•å·¥å‚æ¨¡å¼å¹¶ä¸å±äº23ç§ç»å…¸è®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼,ä½†é€šå¸¸å°†å®ƒä½œä¸ºå­¦ä¹ å…¶ä»–å·¥å‚æ¨¡å¼çš„åŸºç¡€.

    package pers.huangyuhui.curd.dao;import pers.huangyuhui.curd.bean.User;import pers.huangyuhui.curd.utils.DBUitl;import java.sql.Connection;import java.sql.PreparedStatement;import java.sql.ResultSet;import java.sql.SQLException;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.List;/** * @project: curd-demo * @description: æ•°æ®è®¿é—®å±‚(DAO):å¯åˆ©ç”¨JDK8æ–°ç‰¹æ€§Lambdaæ¥ä¼˜åŒ–æ­¤ç¨‹åº * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/22/2019-3:28 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class UserDao {    //è·å–æ•°æ®åº“è¿æ¥    private static Connection connection = DBUitl.getConnection();    //æ·»åŠ ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯    public boolean insertNewUser(User user) {        String sql = "insert into tb_user(name, age, gender, password, telephone, birthday) values (?,?,?,?,?,?)";        try (PreparedStatement preparedStatement = connection.prepareStatement(sql)) {            preparedStatement.setString(1, user.getName());            preparedStatement.setInt(2, user.getAge());            preparedStatement.setString(3, user.getGender());            preparedStatement.setString(4, user.getPassword());            preparedStatement.setString(5, user.getBirthday());            preparedStatement.setString(6, user.getTelephone());            return preparedStatement.executeUpdate() > 0;        } catch (SQLException e) {            e.printStackTrace();        }        return false;    }    //æŸ¥è¯¢æ‰€æœ‰ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯    public List<User> selectAllUser() {        String sql = "select id, name, age, gender, password, telephone, birthday from tb_user";        List<User> list = new ArrayList<>();        try (PreparedStatement preparedStatement = connection.prepareStatement(sql);             ResultSet resultSet = preparedStatement.executeQuery()) {            while (resultSet.next()) {                User user = new User();                user.setId(resultSet.getInt("id"));                user.setName(resultSet.getString("name"));                user.setAge(resultSet.getInt("age"));                user.setGender(resultSet.getString("gender"));                user.setPassword(resultSet.getString("password"));                user.setTelephone(resultSet.getString("telephone"));                user.setBirthday(resultSet.getString("birthday"));                list.add(user);            }            return list;        } catch (SQLException e) {            e.printStackTrace();        }        return null;    }    //æ›´æ–°ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯    public boolean updateUserById(User user) {        String sql = "UPDATE tb_user SET name = ? , gender = ? , age = ? , password = ?, birthday = ?, telephone = ? where id = ?";        try {            PreparedStatement preparedStatement = connection.prepareStatement(sql);            preparedStatement.setString(1, user.getName());            preparedStatement.setString(2, user.getGender());            preparedStatement.setInt(3, user.getAge());            preparedStatement.setString(4, user.getPassword());            preparedStatement.setString(5, user.getBirthday());            preparedStatement.setString(6, user.getTelephone());            preparedStatement.setInt(7, user.getId());            return preparedStatement.executeUpdate() > 0;        } catch (SQLException e) {            e.printStackTrace();        }        return false;    }    //åˆ é™¤ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯    public boolean deleteUserById(Integer id) {        String sql = "delete from tb_user where id = ?";        try {            PreparedStatement preparedStatement = connection.prepareStatement(sql);            preparedStatement.setInt(1, id);            return preparedStatement.executeUpdate() > 0;        } catch (SQLException e) {            e.printStackTrace();        }        return false;    }}

( Template Method Pattern : Define the skeleton of an algorithm in an operation,deferring some steps to subclasses. Template Method lets subclasses redefine certain steps of an algorithm without changing the algorithmâ€™s structure )

  • å…¶æ˜¯ä¸€ç§åŸºäºç»§æ‰¿çš„ä»£ç å¤ç”¨æŠ€æœ¯,å®ƒæ˜¯ä¸€ç§è¡Œä¸ºå‹æ¨¡å¼,å½“ç„¶ä¹Ÿæ˜¯æœ€ç®€å•çš„è¡Œä¸ºè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼ ~

  • å…·ä½“æ–¹æ³• : ä¸€ä¸ªå…·ä½“æ–¹æ³•ç”±æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæŠ½è±¡ç±»æˆ–å…·ä½“ç±»å£°æ˜å¹¶å®ç°,å…¶å­ç±»å¯ä»¥è¿›è¡Œè¦†ç›–ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥è¿›è¡Œç›´æ¥ç»§æ‰¿
  • é’©å­æ–¹æ³• : ä¸€ä¸ªé’©å­æ–¹æ³•ç”±ä¸€ä¸ªæŠ½è±¡ç±»æˆ–è€…å…·ä½“ç±»å£°æ˜å¹¶å®ç°,è€Œå…¶å­ç±»å¯èƒ½ä¼šåŠ ä»¥æ‰©å±•.

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä½¿ç”¨æ¨¡æ¿æ–¹æ³•æ¨¡å¼çš„ç®€å•ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº : é€šè¿‡è‡ªå®šä¹‰æ¨¡æ¿æ ·å¼æ¥æ‰“å°ä¸åŒåŒ…è£¹å­—ç¬¦çš„æ•ˆæœ~

  1. AbstractDisplayæŠ½è±¡ç±» : å……å½“æŠ½è±¡ç±»è§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.template_method.template_method1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å……å½“æŠ½è±¡ç±»è§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/4/2019-10:46 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class AbstractDisplay {    //åŸºæœ¬æ–¹æ³•-æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•    public abstract void open();    //åŸºæœ¬æ–¹æ³•-æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•    public abstract void print();    //åŸºæœ¬æ–¹æ³•-æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•    public abstract void close();    //æ¨¡æ¿æ–¹æ³•:ä¸ºå…·ä½“æ–¹æ³•,å…¶é€»è¾‘çš„ç»„æˆæ­¥éª¤å¯ä»¥æ˜¯å…·ä½“æ–¹æ³•æˆ–æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•..    public /*final*/ void disply() {        open();        for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {            print();        }        close();    }    //åŸºæœ¬æ–¹æ³•-å…·ä½“æ–¹æ³•    //ç•¥Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·    //åŸºæœ¬æ–¹æ³•-é’©å­æ–¹æ³•    //ç•¥Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·}

    package pers.huangyuhui.template_method.template_method1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å……å½“å…·ä½“ç±»è§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/4/2019-10:44 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class CustomDisplay1 extends AbstractDisplay {    private String string;    private int width;    public CustomDisplay1(String string) {        this.string = string;        width = string.getBytes().length;    }    @Override    public void open() {        printLine();    }    @Override    public void print() {        System.out.println("â–ˆ" + string + "â–ˆ");    }    @Override    public void close() {        printLine();    }    private void printLine() {        System.out.print("â—");        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {            System.out.print("â– ");        }        System.out.println("â—");    }}

  3. CustomDisplay2ç±» : å……å½“å…·ä½“ç±»è§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.template_method.template_method1;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å……å½“å…·ä½“ç±»è§’è‰² * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/4/2019-11:03 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class CustomDisplay2 extends AbstractDisplay {    private String string;    private int width;    public CustomDisplay2(String string) {        this.string = string;        this.width = string.getBytes().length;    }    @Override    public void open() {        printLine();    }    @Override    public void print() {        System.out.println("|" + string + "|");    }    @Override    public void close() {        printLine();    }    private void printLine() {        System.out.print("+");        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {            System.out.print("-");        }        System.out.println("+");    }}

  • ConcreteClass( å…·ä½“ç±» ) : è¯¥ç±»è´Ÿè´£å®ç°AbstrctClassä¸­å®šä¹‰çš„æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•,è¿™äº›å®ç°çš„æ–¹æ³•å°†ä¼šåœ¨AbstractClassè§’è‰²çš„æ¨¡æ¿æ–¹æ³•ä¸­åˆ«è°ƒç”¨.

  1. MyWindowAdapteræ¥å£ : å……å½“ç¼ºçœé€‚é…å™¨ç±». WindowListener, MouseListeneræ¥å£ : å……å½“é€‚é…è€…æ¥å£

    package pers.huangyuhui.adapter.adapter3;import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;import java.awt.event.MouseListener;import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;import java.awt.event.WindowListener;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å……å½“ç¼ºçœé€‚é…å™¨ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/3/2019-4:35 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class MyWindowAdapter implements WindowListener, MouseListener {    @Override    public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void mouseEntered(MouseEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void mouseExited(MouseEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowOpened(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowClosed(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowIconified(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowDeiconified(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowActivated(WindowEvent e) {    }    @Override    public void windowDeactivated(WindowEvent e) {    }}

  3. MyContollerç±» : æµ‹è¯•ç±»,åˆ›å»ºJFrameçª—ä½“å¹¶ä¸ºå…¶ç»‘å®šç›‘å¬äº‹ä»¶

    package pers.huangyuhui.adapter.adapter3;import javax.swing.*;import java.awt.event.MouseAdapter;import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;import java.awt.event.WindowAdapter;import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: åˆ›å»ºJFrameçª—ä½“å¹¶ä¸ºå…¶ç»‘å®šç›‘å¬äº‹ä»¶ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/3/2019-4:47 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class MyController {    public static void main(String[] args) {        MyEventService myEventService = new MyEventService();        JFrame j = new JFrame("title");        j.setSize(500, 300);        j.setVisible(true);        j.setLocationRelativeTo(null);        j.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);        //ç»‘å®šäº‹ä»¶        j.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter() {            @Override            public void windowOpened(WindowEvent e) {                myEventService.windowOpened(e);            }            @Override            public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {                myEventService.windowClosing(e);            }        });        j.addMouseListener(new MouseAdapter() {            @Override            public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e) {                myEventService.mouseClicked(e);            }        });    }}

ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åºçš„ç±»å›¾

Adapteræ¨¡å¼ä¸­ç™»åœºçš„è§’è‰²

entry.title: Javaè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼ä¹‹Iteratoræ¨¡å¼
entry.content:
å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®° : Javaè®¾è®¡æ¨¡å¼ä¹‹Iteratoræ¨¡å¼

æ¦‚è¿°

è¿­ä»£å™¨æ¨¡å¼ : æä¾›ä¸€ç§æ–¹æ³•é¡ºåºè®¿é—®ä¸€ä¸ªèšåˆå¯¹è±¡ä¸­çš„å„ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,è€Œåˆä¸æš´éœ²è¯¥å¯¹è±¡çš„å†…éƒ¨è¡¨ç¤º. è¿­ä»£å™¨æ¨¡å¼åˆç§°( Cursor )æ¨¡å¼,å®ƒæ˜¯ä¸€ç§å¯¹è±¡è¡Œä¸ºå‹æ¨¡å¼( Iterator Pattern : Provide a way to access the elements of an aggregate object sequentially without exposing its underlying representation )

ä¸‹é¢æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå®ç°äº†Iteratoræ¨¡å¼çš„ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº,å…¶ä½œç”¨æ˜¯å°†ä¹¦ç±ä¿¡æ¯( Book )æ”¾åˆ°å­˜å‚¨ä¹¦ç±ä¿¡æ¯çš„ä¹¦æ¶( BookSelf )ä¸Š,å¹¶å°†ä¹¦çš„åå­—æŒ‰é¡ºåºæ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥

  1. Book : å›¾ä¹¦ä¿¡æ¯ç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.iterator;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: Bookä¿¡æ¯ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/2/2019-4:59 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Book {    private String name;    public Book(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    public String getName() {        return name;    }}

  2. Aggregateæ¥å£ : å……å½“é›†åˆè§’è‰²

  3. BookSelfç±» : å……å½“å…·ä½“çš„é›†åˆè§’è‰²

    package pers.huangyuhui.iterator;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å…·ä½“çš„é›†åˆ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/2/2019-5:03 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class BookSelf implements Aggregate {    private Book[] books;    private int last = 0;    public BookSelf(int maxsize) {        this.books = new Book[maxsize];    }    public Book getBookByIndex(int index) {        return books[index];    }    public void appendBook(Book book) {        this.books[last++] = book;    }    public int getLength() {        return last;    }    @Override    public Iterator iterator() {        return new BookShelfIterator(this);    }}

  4. Iteratoræ¥å£ : å……å½“è¿­ä»£å™¨è§’è‰²

ä¸‹é¢åŒæ ·æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå®ç°äº†Iteratoræ¨¡å¼çš„ç¤ºä¾‹ç¨‹åº( åŒä¸Š ),å…¶ä½œç”¨æ˜¯å°†å•†å“æ•°æ®å­˜å‚¨åˆ°å•†å“é›†åˆ( ProductList )ä¸­,å¹¶å°†å•†å“çš„åå­—æŒ‰é¡ºåºæ˜¾ç¤ºå‡ºæ¥

  1. AbstractObjectList : æŠ½è±¡èšåˆç±»

    package pers.huangyuhui.iterator2;import java.util.List;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æŠ½è±¡èšåˆç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/2/2019-5:51 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class AbstractObjectList {    protected List<Object> objects;    public AbstractObjectList(List<Object> objects) {        this.objects = objects;    }    public void addObject(Object object) {        this.objects.add(object);    }    public void removeObject(Object object) {        this.objects.remove(object);    }    public List<Object> getObjects() {        return objects;    }    //åˆ›å»ºè¿­ä»£å™¨çš„æŠ½è±¡å·¥å‚æ–¹æ³•    public abstract AbstractIterator iterator();}

  2. ProductList : å•†å“æ•°æ®ç±»,å……å½“å…·ä½“èšåˆç±». ProductIterator(å†…éƒ¨ç±») : å•†å“è¿­ä»£å™¨,å……å½“å…·ä½“è¿­ä»£å™¨

    package pers.huangyuhui.iterator2;import java.util.List;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: å•†å“ä¹¦ç±ç±», å……å½“å…·ä½“èšåˆç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/2/2019-5:56 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class ProductList extends AbstractObjectList {    public ProductList(List<Object> objects) {        super(objects);    }    @Override    public AbstractIterator iterator() {        return new ProductIterator();    }    /*    ProductIterator:å•†å“è¿­ä»£å™¨,å……å½“å…·ä½“è¿­ä»£å™¨(ä½¿ç”¨å†…éƒ¨ç±»å®ç°è¿­ä»£å™¨,ä¸jdkä¸­çš„è¿­ä»£å™¨å®ç°åŸç†ç›¸åŒ)    */    public class ProductIterator implements AbstractIterator {        private int cursor;        public ProductIterator() {            cursor = 0;        }        @Override        public boolean hasNext() {            return cursor < objects.size();        }        @Override        public Object next() {            return objects.get(cursor++);        }    }}

    package pers.huangyuhui.iterator2;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.List;/** * @project: design-patterns * @description: æµ‹è¯•ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/2/2019-6:13 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Test {    //demo    public static void main(String[] args) {        List<Object> arrayList = new ArrayList<>();        arrayList.add("A-BOOK");        arrayList.add("B-BOOK");        arrayList.add("C-BOOK");        ProductList productList = new ProductList(arrayList);        productList.addObject("D-BOOK");        productList.addObject("E-BOOK");        productList.removeObject("A-BOOK");        AbstractIterator iterator = productList.iterator();        while (iterator.hasNext()) {            System.out.println(iterator.next());        }        System.out.println("all datas : " + productList.getObjects().toString());    }}

å•ä¸€èŒè´£åŸåˆ™

  • Single Responsibility Principle( SRP ) : Every object should have a single responsibility,and that responsibility should be entirely encapsulated by the calss.

å¼€é—­åŸåˆ™

  • Open-Closed Principle( OCP ) : Software entities should be open for extension,but closed for modification.

é‡Œæ°ä»£æ¢åŸåˆ™

ä¾èµ–å€’è½¬åŸåˆ™

  • Dependence Inversion Principle( DIP ) : High level modules should not depend upon low level modules,both should depend upon abstractions. Abstractions should not depend upon details,details should depend upon abstractions.

æ¥å£éš”ç¦»åŸåˆ™

æ¥å£éš”ç¦»åŸåˆ™ : å®¢æˆ·ç«¯ä¸åº”è¯¥ä¾èµ–é‚£äº›å®ƒä¸éœ€è¦çš„æ¥å£

  • Interface Segregation Principle( ISP ) : Clients should not be forced to depend upon interfaces that they do not use.

åˆæˆå¤ç”¨åŸåˆ™

åˆæˆå¤ç”¨åŸåˆ™ : ä¼˜å…ˆä½¿ç”¨å¯¹è±¡ç»„åˆ,è€Œä¸æ˜¯é€šè¿‡ç»§æ‰¿æ¥è¾¾åˆ°å¤ç”¨çš„ç›®çš„

  • Composite Reuse Principle(CRP) : Favor composition of objects over inheritance as reuse mechanism.

è¿ªç±³ç‰¹æ³•åˆ™

è¿ªç±³ç‰¹æ³•åˆ™ : æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªè½¯ä»¶å•ä½å¯¹å…¶ä»–å•ä½éƒ½åªæœ‰æœ€å°‘çš„çŸ¥è¯†,è€Œä¸”ä»…é™äºé‚£äº›ä¸æœ¬å•ä½å¯†åˆ‡ç›¸å…³çš„è½¯ä»¶å•ä½

  • Law of Demeter( LoD ) : Each unit should have only limited knowledge about other units : only units â€œcloselyâ€ related to the current unit.

entry.content:
å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®° : è¯¦è§£Binary Treeçš„å®ç°æ–¹å¼åŠå…¶åº”ç”¨

ä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯äºŒå‰æ ‘

å¦‚æœä¸€æ£µæ ‘ä¸­çš„æ¯ä¸ªç»“ç‚¹æœ‰0,1æˆ–è€…2ä¸ªå­©å­ç»“ç‚¹,é‚£ä¹ˆè¿™é¢—æ ‘å°±ç§°ä¸ºäºŒå‰æ ‘. ç©ºæ ‘ä¹Ÿæ˜¯ä¸€æ£µæœ‰æ•ˆçš„äºŒå‰æ ‘. ä¸€ä¸ªäºŒå‰æ ‘å¯ä»¥çœ‹ä½œç”±æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹å’Œä¸¤é¢—ä¸ç›¸äº¤çš„å­æ ‘( åˆ†åˆ«ç§°ä¸ºå·¦å­æ ‘å’Œå³å­æ ‘ )ç»„æˆ. å…¶ç±»å‹å¯åˆ†ä¸º : ä¸¥æ ¼äºŒå‰æ ‘,æ»¡äºŒå‰æ ‘,å®Œå…¨äºŒå‰æ ‘.

äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„åº”ç”¨

  • ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä¸­çš„è¡¨è¾¾å¼æ ‘
  • ç”¨äºæ•°æ®å‹ç¼©ç®—æ³•ä¸­çš„èµ«å¤«æ›¼ç¼–ç æ ‘
  • æ”¯æŒåœ¨é›†åˆä¸­æŸ¥æ‰¾,æ’å…¥å’Œåˆ é™¤,å…¶å¹³å‡æ—¶é—´å¤æ‚åº¦ä¸º O(logn) çš„äºŒå‰æ ‘æœç´¢(æˆ–ç§°ä¸ºæŸ¥æ‰¾)æ ‘( BST )
  • ä¼˜å…ˆé˜Ÿåˆ—( PQ ),å®ƒæ”¯æŒä»¥å¯¹æ•°æ—¶é—´( æœ€åæƒ…å†µä¸‹ )å¯¹é›†åˆä¸­çš„æœ€å°( æˆ–æœ€å¤§ )æ•°æ®è¿›è¡Œæœç´¢å’Œåˆ é™¤

äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„éå†

æ ¹æ®å®ä½“( ç»“ç‚¹ )å¤„ç†é¡ºåºä¸åŒ,å¯ä»¥å®šä¹‰ä¸åŒçš„éå†æ–¹æ³•. å…¶åˆ†ç±»å¦‚ä¸‹ :

  • å‰åºéå†( DLR ) : æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹ â€”â€”> å·¦å­æ ‘ â€”â€”> å³å­æ ‘
  • ä¸­åºéå†( LDR ) : å·¦å­æ ‘ â€”â€”> æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹ â€”â€”> å³å­æ ‘
  • ååºéå†( LRD ) : å·¦å­æ ‘ â€”â€”> å³å­æ ‘ â€”â€”> æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹
  • å±‚æ¬¡éå† : è¿™ç§æ–¹æ³•ç”±å›¾çš„å¹¿åº¦ä¼˜å…ˆéå†æ–¹æ³•å¯å‘å¾—æ¥

ç¨‹åºå®ä¾‹

  1. å®šä¹‰äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„ç»“æ„

    package pers.huangyuhui.tree;/** * @project: data structures and algorithms * @description: å®šä¹‰äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„ç»“æ„ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-2:59 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class BinaryTreeNode {    private int data;    private BinaryTreeNode left;    private BinaryTreeNode right;    public BinaryTreeNode() {    }    public BinaryTreeNode(int data) {        this.data = data;    }    public BinaryTreeNode(int data, BinaryTreeNode left, BinaryTreeNode right) {        this.data = data;        this.left = left;        this.right = right;    }    public int getData() {        return data;    }    public void setData(int data) {        this.data = data;    }    public BinaryTreeNode getLeft() {        return left;    }    public void setLeft(BinaryTreeNode left) {        this.left = left;    }    public BinaryTreeNode getRight() {        return right;    }    public void setRight(BinaryTreeNode right) {        this.right = right;    }}

  2. å®šä¹‰å•å‘é“¾è¡¨çš„ç»“æ„

    package pers.huangyuhui.tree;/** * @project: data structures and algorithms * @description: å®šä¹‰å•å‘é“¾è¡¨çš„ç»“æ„ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-5:09 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class LLNode<T> {    private T data;    private LLNode next;    public LLNode() {    }    public LLNode(T data) {        this.data = data;    }    public T getData() {        return data;    }    public void setData(T data) {        this.data = data;    }    public LLNode getNext() {        return next;    }    public void setNext(LLNode next) {        this.next = next;    }}

  3. åŸºäºå•å‘é“¾è¡¨æ¥å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæ ˆ

    package pers.huangyuhui.tree;/** * @project: data structures and algorithms * @description: åŸºäºå•å‘é“¾è¡¨å®ç°æ ˆ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-3:10 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class LLStack<T> {    private LLNode<T> headNode;    public LLStack() {        this.headNode = new LLNode<>();    }    public boolean isEmpty() {        return headNode == null;    }    //æ ˆé¡¶    public T top() {        if (headNode == null) {            return null;        } else {            return headNode.getData();        }    }    //å…¥æ ˆ    public void push(T data) {        if (isEmpty()) {            headNode = new LLNode<>(data);        } else if (headNode.getData() == null) {            headNode.setData(data);        } else {            var llNode = new LLNode<>(data);            llNode.setNext(headNode);            headNode = llNode;        }    }    //å‡ºæ ˆ    public T pop() {        if (isEmpty()) {            return null;        } else {            var data = headNode.getData();            headNode = headNode.getNext();            return data;        }    }}

  4. åˆ†åˆ«æµ‹è¯•äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„å‰åº,ä¸­åº,ååºéå†æ–¹å¼

    package pers.huangyuhui.tree;/** * @project: data structures and algorithms * @description: äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„éå†æ–¹å¼ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-2:24 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class BinaryTree {    public static BinaryTreeNode initBinaryTree() {        BinaryTreeNode root = new BinaryTreeNode();        root.setData(1); //æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹        root.setLeft(new BinaryTreeNode(2, new BinaryTreeNode(4), new BinaryTreeNode(5))); //å·¦å­æ ‘        root.setRight(new BinaryTreeNode(3, new BinaryTreeNode(6), new BinaryTreeNode(7))); //å³å­æ ‘        return root;    }    //é€’å½’å‰åºéå†    public void preOrder(BinaryTreeNode root) {        if (root != null) {            System.out.print(root.getData() + ", ");            preOrder(root.getLeft());            preOrder(root.getRight());        }    }    //éé€’å½’å‰åºéå†    public void preOrderNonRecursive(BinaryTreeNode root) {        if (root == null) {            System.err.println("error : the tree is empty");        }        var stack = new LLStack<BinaryTreeNode>();        while (true) {            while (root != null) {                System.out.print(root.getData() + ", ");                stack.push(root);                root = root.getLeft();            }            if (stack.isEmpty()) {                break;            }            root = stack.pop();            root = root.getRight();        }    }    //é€’å½’ä¸­åºéå†    public void inOrder(BinaryTreeNode root) {        if (root != null) {            inOrder(root.getLeft());            System.out.print(root.getData() + ", ");            inOrder(root.getRight());        }    }    //éé€’å½’ä¸­åºéå†    public void inOrderNonRecursive(BinaryTreeNode root) {        if (root == null) {            System.err.println("error : the tree is empty");        }        var stack = new LLStack<BinaryTreeNode>();        while (true) {            while (root != null) {                stack.push(root);                root = root.getLeft();            }            if (stack.isEmpty()) {                break;            }            root = stack.pop();            System.out.print(root.getData() + ", ");            root = root.getRight();        }    }    //é€’å½’ååºéå†    public void postOrder(BinaryTreeNode root) {        if (root != null) {            postOrder(root.getLeft());            postOrder(root.getRight());            System.out.print(root.getData() + ", ");        }    }    //éé€’å½’ååºéå†    public void postNonRecursive(BinaryTreeNode root) {        //Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·    }    //test    public static void main(String[] args) {        BinaryTree binaryTree = new BinaryTree();        BinaryTreeNode binaryTreeNode = BinaryTree.initBinaryTree();        System.out.println("------ é€’å½’å‰åºéå† ------");        binaryTree.preOrder(binaryTreeNode); //1,2,4,5,3,6,7        System.out.println("
------ éé€’å½’å‰åºéå† ------");        binaryTree.preOrderNonRecursive(binaryTreeNode);        System.out.println("
------ é€’å½’ä¸­åºéå† ------");        binaryTree.inOrder(binaryTreeNode); //4,2,5,1,6,3,7        System.out.println("
------ éé€’å½’ä¸­åºéå† ------");        binaryTree.inOrderNonRecursive(binaryTreeNode);        System.out.println("
------ é€’å½’ååºéå† ------");        binaryTree.postOrder(binaryTreeNode); //4,5,2,6,7,3,1    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.queue;import java.util.Arrays;/** * @project: Data structures and algorithms * @description: åŸºäºç®€å•å¾ªç¯æ•°ç»„å®ç°é˜Ÿåˆ— * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/31/2019-9:59 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class ArrayQueue {    private int front;    private int rear;    private int capacity;    private int[] array;    public ArrayQueue(int size) {        this.capacity = size;        front = rear = -1;        array = new int[size];    }    public static ArrayQueue createQueue(int size) {        return new ArrayQueue(size);    }    public boolean isEmpty() {        return (front == -1);    }    public boolean isFull() {        return ((rear + 1) % capacity == front);    }    public void traverse() {        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(array));    }    public int getQueueSize() {        if (front == -1) {            return 0;        }        int size = (capacity - front + rear + 1) % capacity;        if (size == 0) {            return capacity;        } else {            return size;        }    }    //å…¥é˜Ÿ    public void enQueue(int data) {        if (isFull()) {            System.err.println("error : the queue is overflow");        } else {            rear = (rear + 1) % capacity;            array[rear] = data;            if (front == -1) {                front = rear;            }            System.out.println("enter the data into the queue successfully : " + data);        }    }    //å‡ºé˜Ÿ    public int deQueue() {        int data = 0;        if (isEmpty()) {            System.err.println("error : the queue is empty");        } else {            data = array[front];            array[front] = 0;            if (front == rear) {                front = rear = -1;            } else {                front = (front + 1) % capacity;            }            System.out.println("delete the data from the queue successfully : " + data);        }        return data;    }    //test    public static void main(String[] args) {        ArrayQueue queue = ArrayQueue.createQueue(5);        //enter        queue.enQueue(1);        queue.enQueue(2);        queue.enQueue(3);        queue.enQueue(4);        queue.enQueue(5);        System.out.println("the size of queue : " + queue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        queue.traverse();        //delete        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        System.out.println("the size of queue : " + queue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        queue.traverse();    }}

enter the data into the queue successfully : 1enter the data into the queue successfully : 2enter the data into the queue successfully : 3enter the data into the queue successfully : 4enter the data into the queue successfully : 5the size of queue : 5traverse the queue : [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]delete the data from the queue successfully : 1delete the data from the queue successfully : 2delete the data from the queue successfully : 3delete the data from the queue successfully : 4delete the data from the queue successfully : 5the size of queue : 0traverse the queue : [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

package pers.huangyuhui.queue;import java.util.Arrays;/** * @project: Data structures and algorithms * @description: åŸºäºåŠ¨æ€å¾ªç¯æ•°ç»„å®ç°é˜Ÿåˆ— * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-8:59 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class DynArrayQueue {    private int front;    private int rear;    private int capacity;    private int[] array;    private DynArrayQueue() {        capacity = 1;        front = rear = -1;        array = new int[1];    }    public static DynArrayQueue createDynArrayQueue() {        return new DynArrayQueue();    }    public boolean isEmpty() {        return (front == -1);    }    public boolean isFull() {        return ((rear + 1) % capacity == front);    }    public void traverse() {        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(array));    }    public int getQueueSize() {        if (front == -1) {            return 0;        }        int size = (capacity - front + rear + 1) % capacity;        if (size == 0) {            return capacity;        } else {            return size;        }    }    //æ‰©å®¹    private void resizeQueue() {        int initCapacity = capacity;        capacity *= 2;        int[] oldArray = array;        array = new int[this.capacity];        for (int i = 0; i < oldArray.length; i++) {            array[i] = oldArray[i];        }        //important        if (rear < front) {            for (int i = 0; i < front; i++) {                array[i + initCapacity] = this.array[i];                array[i] = 0;            }            rear += initCapacity;        }    }    //å…¥é˜Ÿ    public void enQueue(int data) {        if (isFull()) {            resizeQueue();        }        rear = (rear + 1) % capacity;        array[rear] = data;        if (front == -1) {            front = rear;        }        System.out.println("enter a data into the queue successfully : " + data);    }    //å‡ºé˜Ÿ    public int deQueue() {        int data = -1;        if (isEmpty()) {            System.err.println("error : the queue is empty");        } else {            data = array[front];            array[front] = 0; //delete the data            if (front == rear) {                front = rear = -1;            } else {                front = (front + 1) % capacity;            }            System.out.println("delete a data from the queue successfully : " + data);        }        return data;    }    //test    public static void main(String[] args) {        DynArrayQueue dynArrayQueue = DynArrayQueue.createDynArrayQueue();        //enter        dynArrayQueue.enQueue(1);        dynArrayQueue.enQueue(2);        dynArrayQueue.enQueue(3);        dynArrayQueue.enQueue(4);        dynArrayQueue.enQueue(5);        System.out.println("the size of queue : " + dynArrayQueue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        dynArrayQueue.traverse();        //delete        dynArrayQueue.deQueue();        dynArrayQueue.deQueue();        dynArrayQueue.deQueue();        dynArrayQueue.deQueue();        dynArrayQueue.deQueue();        System.out.println("the size of queue : " + dynArrayQueue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        dynArrayQueue.traverse();    }}

enter a data into the queue successfully : 1enter a data into the queue successfully : 2enter a data into the queue successfully : 3enter a data into the queue successfully : 4enter a data into the queue successfully : 5the size of queue : 5traverse the queue : [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 0, 0, 0]delete a data from the queue successfully : 1delete a data from the queue successfully : 2delete a data from the queue successfully : 3delete a data from the queue successfully : 4delete a data from the queue successfully : 5the size of queue : 0traverse the queue : [0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

package pers.huangyuhui.queue;//å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªå•å‘é“¾è¡¨class LLNode {    private int data;    private LLNode next;    public LLNode(int data) {        this.data = data;    }    public int getData() {        return data;    }    public void setData(int data) {        this.data = data;    }    public LLNode getNext() {        return next;    }    public void setNext(LLNode next) {        this.next = next;    }}/** * @project: Data structures and algorithms * @description: åŸºäºé“¾è¡¨å®ç°é˜Ÿåˆ— * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 9/1/2019-9:19 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class LLQueue {    private LLNode frontNode; //represents headNode    private LLNode rearNode; //represents lastNode    public LLQueue() {        this.frontNode = null;        this.rearNode = null;    }    public static LLQueue createQueue() {        return new LLQueue();    }    public boolean isEmpty() {        return (frontNode == null);    }    public int getQueueSize() {        int length = 0;        LLNode currentNode = frontNode;        while (currentNode != null) {            length++;            currentNode = currentNode.getNext();        }        return length;    }    //éå†    public void traverse() {        if (isEmpty()) {            System.err.println("error : the queue is empty !");            return;        }        LLNode currentNode = frontNode;        System.out.print("the all data of queue : [ ");        while (currentNode != null) {            System.out.print(currentNode.getData() + " ,");            currentNode = currentNode.getNext();        }        System.out.print(" ]\n");    }    //å…¥é˜Ÿ    public void enQueue(int data) {        LLNode newNode = new LLNode(data);        if (rearNode != null) {            rearNode.setNext(newNode);        }        rearNode = newNode;        if (frontNode == null) {            frontNode = rearNode;        }        System.out.println("enter the data into the queue successfully : " + data);    }    //å‡ºé˜Ÿ    public int deQueue() {        int data = 0;        if (isEmpty()) {            System.err.println("error : the queue is empty");        } else {            data = frontNode.getData();            frontNode = frontNode.getNext();        }        System.out.println("delete the data from the queue successfully : " + data);        return data;    }    //test    public static void main(String[] args) {        LLQueue queue = LLQueue.createQueue();        //enter        queue.enQueue(1);        queue.enQueue(2);        queue.enQueue(3);        queue.enQueue(4);        queue.enQueue(5);        System.out.println("the size of the queue : " + queue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        queue.traverse();        //delete        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        queue.deQueue();        System.out.println("the size of the queue : " + queue.getQueueSize());        System.out.print("traverse the queue : ");        queue.traverse();    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.memo.service.impl;import com.github.pagehelper.PageHelper;import com.github.pagehelper.PageInfo;import pers.huangyuhui.memo.object.BaseConditionVO;import pers.huangyuhui.memo.dao.BaseMapper;import pers.huangyuhui.memo.service.BaseService;import java.io.Serializable;import java.util.List;/** * @project: memo * @description: é€šç”¨çš„Serviceå®ç°ç±» * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/22/2019-8:55 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public abstract class AbstractService<T, ID extends Serializable> implements BaseService<T, ID> {    private BaseMapper<T, ID> baseMapper;    //åˆå§‹åŒ–baseMapper    public void setBaseMapper(BaseMapper<T, ID> baseMapper) {        this.baseMapper = baseMapper;    }    @Override    public int deleteByPrimaryKey(ID[] id) {        return baseMapper.deleteByPrimaryKey(id);    }    @Override    public int insertSelective(T record) {        return baseMapper.insertSelective(record);    }    @Override    public T selectByPrimaryKey(ID id) {        return baseMapper.selectByPrimaryKey(id);    }    @Override    public List<T> selectBySelective(T record) {        return baseMapper.selectBySelective(record);    }    @Override    public PageInfo<T> selectForPage(T record, BaseConditionVO baseConditionVO) {        PageHelper.startPage(baseConditionVO.getPageNum(), baseConditionVO.getPageSize()); //è®¾ç½®æ¯é¡µçš„è®°å½•æ•°        List<T> list = baseMapper.selectBySelective(record); //è·å–åˆ—è¡¨ä¿¡æ¯        return new PageInfo<>(list);    }    @Override    public int updateByPrimaryKeySelective(T record) {        return baseMapper.updateByPrimaryKey(record);    }    @Override    public int updateByPrimaryKeyWithBLOBs(T record) {        return baseMapper.updateByPrimaryKeyWithBLOBs(record);    }    @Override    public int updateByPrimaryKey(T record) {        return baseMapper.updateByPrimaryKey(record);    }    @Override    public int insert(T record) {        return baseMapper.insert(record);    }}

//JDK7ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¹‹å‰é‡Šæ”¾èµ„æºçš„å†™æ³•public void testTry() {    InputStreamReader reader = null;    try {        reader = new InputStreamReader(System.in);        char[] buffer = new char[50];        int len;        if ((len = reader.read(buffer)) != -1) {            String s = new String(buffer, 0, len);            System.out.println(s);        }    } catch (IOException e) {        e.printStackTrace();    } finally {        if (reader != null) {            try {                reader.close();            } catch (IOException e) {                e.printStackTrace();            }        }    }}//JDK7ç‰ˆæœ¬é‡Šæ”¾èµ„æºçš„å†™æ³•public void testTryWithJDK7() {    try (InputStreamReader reader = new InputStreamReader(System.in)) {        //reader = null; //æ³¨æ„:æ­¤æ—¶readerå·²è¢«ä¸ºè®¾ç½®ä¸ºå¸¸é‡,æ—¢è€Œä¸èƒ½ä¿®æ”¹        char[] buffer = new char[50];        int len;        if ((len = reader.read(buffer)) != -1) {            String s = new String(buffer, 0, len);            System.out.println(s);        }    } catch (IOException e) {        e.printStackTrace();    }}//JDK9ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¼˜åŒ–äº†JDK7é‡Šæ”¾èµ„æºçš„å†™æ³•public void testTryWithJDK9() {    InputStreamReader reader = new InputStreamReader(System.in);    OutputStreamWriter writer = new OutputStreamWriter(System.out);//unused    try (reader; writer) {        char[] buffer = new char[50];        int len;        if ((len = reader.read(buffer)) != -1) {            String s = new String(buffer, 0, len);            System.out.println(s);        }    } catch (IOException e) {        e.printStackTrace();    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.jdk9;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.*;/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: å¿«é€Ÿåˆ›å»ºåªè¯»é›†åˆ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/21/2019-1:19 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class CollectionTest {    //åœ¨JDK9ä¹‹å‰åˆ›å»ºåªè¯»é›†åˆ    @Test    public void test() {        List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();        list.add("A");        list.add("B");        list.add("C");        //å°†Listé›†åˆè®¾ä¸ºåªè¯»        list = Collections.unmodifiableList(list);        System.out.println(list);        Set<String> set = new HashSet<>();        set.add("E");        set.add("F");        set.add("G");        //å°†Seté›†åˆè®¾ä¸ºåªè¯»        set = Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);        System.out.println(set);        Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<>();        map.put("k1", "v1");        map.put("k2", "v2");        map.put("k3", "v3");        //å°†Mapé›†åˆè®¾ä¸ºåªè¯»        map = Collections.unmodifiableMap(map);        System.out.println(map);    }    //åœ¨JDK9ä¸­,å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨ofæ–¹æ³•ç›´æ¥å¿«é€Ÿåˆ›å»ºåªè¯»é›†åˆ    @Test    public void testWithJDK9() {        //åˆ›å»ºListåªè¯»é›†åˆ        List<String> list = List.of("A", "B", "C");        System.out.println(list);        //åˆ›å»ºSetåªè¯»é›†åˆ        Set<String> set = Set.of("E", "F", "G");        System.out.println(set);        //åˆ›å»ºListåªè¯»é›†åˆ        Map<String, String> map = Map.of("k1", "v1", "k2", "v2", "k3", "v3");        System.out.println(map);    }}

public void testStream() {    //takeWhile: å¯ä»¥ç”¨äºä»Streamä¸­è·å–ä¸€éƒ¨åˆ†æ•°æ®,æ¥å—ä¸€ä¸ªPredicateæ¥è¿›è¡Œé€‰æ‹©,åœ¨æœ‰åºçš„Streamä¸­,takeWhileè¿”å›ä»å¤´å¼€å§‹çš„å°½å¯èƒ½å¤šçš„å…ƒç´     List<Integer> list = Arrays.asList(45, 43, 76, 87, 42, 77, 90, 73, 67, 88);    list.stream().takeWhile((x) -> x < 80).forEach(System.out::println);    //è¿è¡Œç»“æœ : 45 43 76    //ä»è¿”å›ç»“æœå¯ä»¥çœ‹å‡º:takeWhileå°†ä¼šæŒ‰ç…§listé›†åˆæœ‰åºçš„ä»45å¼€å§‹åˆ°ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªä¸ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶ä¸ºæ­¢çš„æ‰€æœ‰ç»“æœ    //dropWhile: dropWhileæ–¹æ³•åˆšå¥½ä¸takeWhileæƒ³æ³•,è¿”å›å‰©ä½™çš„å…ƒç´     List<Integer> list2 = Arrays.asList(45, 43, 76, 87, 42, 77, 90, 73, 67, 88);    //System.out.println(stream1.count());//NullPointerException    //ä¸æŠ¥å¼‚å¸¸,å…è®¸è¿™æ ·å†™    Stream<String> stringStream = Stream.of("AA", "BB", null);    System.out.println(stringStream.count());    System.out.println(stream.count()); //ç¨‹åºè¿è¡Œç»“æœ:0    Stream<String> stream2 = Stream.ofNullable("Hello World");    System.out.println(stream2.count()); //ç¨‹åºè¿è¡Œç»“æœ:1    //iterate()çš„é‡è½½æ–¹æ³•    //JDK8 ä½¿ç”¨iterateæ–¹æ³•,éœ€é…åˆlimitæˆªæ­¢    Stream.iterate(1, (x) -> x + 1).limit(10).forEach(System.out::print); ç°æœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªArrayListé›†åˆåˆ†åˆ«å­˜å‚¨ç€è‹¥å¹²ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,è¦æ±‚ : ä¸€ä½¿ç”¨ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„forå¾ªç¯ / å¢å¼ºforå¾ªç¯ä¾æ¬¡è¿›è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹è‹¥å¹²æ“ä½œæ­¥éª¤, äºŒä½¿ç”¨Streamæµçš„æ–¹å¼ä¾æ¬¡è¿›è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹è‹¥å¹²æ“ä½œæ­¥éª¤,ç›¸ä¿¡æœ€åä½ å®šä¼šä½“ä¼šåˆ°Streamçš„ç¾ (âœªÏ‰âœª)~

  4. ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªé›†åˆç­›é€‰ä¹‹åä¸è¦å‰2ä¸¤ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­

  6. æ ¹æ®åˆå¹¶åçš„é›†åˆä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ å€¼åˆ›å»ºElementå¯¹è±¡,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­
  7. æ‰“å°æ•´ä¸ªé›†åˆçš„Elementå¯¹è±¡ä¿¡æ¯

package pers.huangyuhui.jdk8.Stream;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.List;//å®šä¹‰Elementç±»class Element {    private String name;    public Element(String name) {        this.name = name;    }    @Override    public String toString() {        return "Element{" + "name='" + name + '\'' + '}';    }}/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: ä¼ ç»Ÿæ–¹å¼çš„ä»£ç å®ç° * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/19/2019-1:32 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Eaxmple {    @Test    public void testExample() {        //Aé›†åˆ        List<String> alist = new ArrayList<>();        alist.add("ABC");        alist.add("BCD");        alist.add("CDE");        alist.add("DEF");        alist.add("EFG");        alist.add("EEE");        //1.ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆåªè¦åŒ…å«'E'å­—ç¬¦çš„å…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<String> alistA = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : alist) {            if (s.contains("E")) {                alistA.add(s);            }        }        //2.ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆç­›é€‰ä¹‹ååªè¦å‰3ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<String> alistB = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : alistA) {            if (alistB.size() != 3) {                alistB.add(s); //[CDE, DEF, EFG]            }        }        //Bé›†åˆ        List<String> blist = new ArrayList<>();        blist.add("HIJ");        blist.add("IJK");        blist.add("JKL");        blist.add("KLM");        blist.add("KKK");        //3.ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªé›†åˆåªè¦åŒ…å«'K'å­—ç¬¦çš„å…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<String> blistA = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : blist) {            if (s.contains("K")) {                blistA.add(s);            }        }        //4.ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªé›†åˆç­›é€‰ä¹‹åä¸è¦å‰2ä¸¤ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<String> blistB = new ArrayList<>();        for (int i = 2; i < blistA.size(); i++) {            blistB.add(blistA.get(i)); //[KLM, KKK]        }        //5.å°†ä¸¤ä¸ªé›†åˆåˆå¹¶æˆä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆ,å¹¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<String> abList = new ArrayList<>();        abList.addAll(alistB);        abList.addAll(blistB);        //6.æ ¹æ®åˆå¹¶åçš„é›†åˆä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ å€¼åˆ›å»ºElementå¯¹è±¡,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        List<Element> pList = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : abList) {            pList.add(new Element(s));        }        //7.æ‰“å°æ•´ä¸ªé›†åˆçš„Elementå¯¹è±¡ä¿¡æ¯        for (Element element : pList) {            System.out.println(element.toString());        }    }}

ç¨‹åºè¿è¡Œç»“æœå¦‚ä¸‹ :

package pers.huangyuhui.jdk8.Stream;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.List;import java.util.stream.Stream;//å®šä¹‰Elementç±»class Element {    private String value;    public Element(String value) {        this.value = value;    }    @Override    public String toString() {        return "Element{" + "value='" + value + '\'' + '}';    }}/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: ä½¿ç”¨Streamæµçš„ä»£ç å®ç° * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/19/2019-3:57 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class Example {    @Test    public void testWithStream() {        //Aé›†åˆ        List<String> alist = new ArrayList<>();        alist.add("ABC");        alist.add("BCD");        alist.add("CDE");        alist.add("DEF");        alist.add("EFG");        alist.add("EEE");        //1.ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆåªè¦åŒ…å«'E'å­—ç¬¦çš„å…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        //2.ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆç­›é€‰ä¹‹ååªè¦å‰3ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        Stream<String> streamA = alist.stream()                .filter(value -> value.contains("E"))                .limit(3);        //Bé›†åˆ        List<String> blist = new ArrayList<>();        blist.add("HIJ");        blist.add("IJK");        blist.add("JKL");        blist.add("KLM");        blist.add("KKK");        //3.ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªé›†åˆåªè¦åŒ…å«'K'å­—ç¬¦çš„å…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        //4.ç¬¬äºŒä¸ªé›†åˆç­›é€‰ä¹‹åä¸è¦å‰2ä¸¤ä¸ªå…ƒç´ ,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        Stream<String> streamB = blist.stream()                .filter(value -> value.contains("K"))                .skip(2);        //5.å°†ä¸¤ä¸ªé›†åˆåˆå¹¶æˆä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆ,å¹¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°é›†åˆä¸­        //6.æ ¹æ®åˆå¹¶åçš„é›†åˆä¸­çš„å…ƒç´ å€¼åˆ›å»ºElementå¯¹è±¡,å¹¶å°†å…¶å­˜å‚¨åˆ°æ–°é›†åˆä¸­        //7.æ‰“å°æ•´ä¸ªé›†åˆçš„Elementå¯¹è±¡ä¿¡æ¯        Stream.concat(streamA, streamB)                .map(Element::new) //.map(value -> new Element(value))                .forEach(System.out::println);    }}

  • å†…éƒ¨è¿­ä»£ : ä»¥å‰å¯¹é›†åˆéå†éƒ½æ˜¯é€šè¿‡Iteratoræˆ–è€…For-Eachçš„æ–¹å¼, æ˜¾å¼çš„åœ¨é›†åˆå¤–éƒ¨è¿›è¡Œè¿­ä»£,è¿™å«åšå¤–éƒ¨è¿­ä»£. Streamåˆ™æä¾›äº†å†…éƒ¨è¿­ä»£çš„æ–¹å¼,é€šè¿‡è®¿é—®è€…æ¨¡å¼(Visitor)å®ç°

å½“ä½¿ç”¨ä¸€ä¸ªæµçš„æ—¶å€™,é€šå¸¸åŒ…æ‹¬ä¸‰ä¸ªåŸºæœ¬æ­¥éª¤ : è·å–ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°æ®æº(source) -> æ•°æ®è½¬æ¢ -> æ‰§è¡Œæ“ä½œè·å–æƒ³è¦çš„ç»“æœ,æ¯æ¬¡è½¬æ¢åŸæœ‰ Stream å¯¹è±¡ä¸æ”¹å˜,è¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„ Stream å¯¹è±¡(å¯ä»¥æœ‰å¤šæ¬¡è½¬æ¢),è¿™å°±å…è®¸å¯¹å…¶æ“ä½œå¯ä»¥åƒé“¾æ¡ä¸€æ ·æ’åˆ—,å˜æˆä¸€ä¸ªç®¡é“. æ³¨ : Steamæµå±äºç®¡é“æµ,æ—¢åªèƒ½è¢«æ¶ˆè´¹/ä½¿ç”¨ä¸€æ¬¡å“Ÿ

java.util.stream.Stream<T>æ˜¯Java8æ–°åŠ å…¥çš„æœ€å¸¸ç”¨çš„æµæ¥å£ (æ³¨ : è¿™å¹¶ä¸æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£å“Ÿ),è·å–ä¸€ä¸ªæµéå¸¸ç®€å•,æœ‰ä»¥ä¸‹å‡ ç§å¸¸ç”¨çš„æ–¹å¼ :

package pers.huangyuhui.Stream;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.List;/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: ä½¿ç”¨Streamæµéå†å¹¶è¿‡æ»¤é›†åˆ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-9:10 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class StreamTest {    //ä¼ ç»Ÿæ–¹å¼:éå†å¹¶è¿‡æ»¤é›†åˆ    @Test    public void test() {        List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();        list.add("a");        list.add("bc");        list.add("abc");        list.add("bcd");        list.add("abcd");        //å…ƒç´ å†…å®¹è¿‡æ»¤        List<String> list_a = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : list) {            if (s.startsWith("a")) {                list_a.add(s);            }        }        //å…ƒç´ é•¿åº¦è¿‡æ»¤        List<String> list_len = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : list_a) {            if (s.length() > 3) {                list_len.add(s);            }        }        //æ‰“å°é›†åˆå…ƒç´         for (String s : list_len) {            System.out.println(s); //ç»“æœ:abcd        }    }    //ä½¿ç”¨Steamæµ:éå†å¹¶è¿‡æ»¤é›†åˆ    @Test    public void testWithStream() {        List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();        list.add("a");        list.add("bc");        list.add("abc");        list.add("bcd");        list.add("abcd");        //è¿‡æ»¤é›†åˆå…ƒç´ åè¾“å‡º        list.stream()                .filter(name -> name.startsWith("a")) //å…ƒç´ å†…å®¹è¿‡æ»¤                .filter(name -> name.length() > 3) //å…ƒç´ é•¿åº¦è¿‡æ»¤                //.forEach(name -> System.out.println(name));                .forEach(System.out::println); //ç»“æœ:abcd    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.Stream;import java.util.*;import java.util.stream.Stream;/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: è·å–æµçš„ä¸¤ç§æ–¹å¼:å°†é›†åˆè£…æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ,åŠå°†æ•°ç»„è½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/19/2019-8:30 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class GetStreamWay {    //å°†Listé›†åˆè£…æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ    public void testList() {        List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();        Stream<String> stream = list.stream();    }    //å°†Seté›†åˆè½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ    public void testSet() {        Set<String> set = new HashSet<>();        Stream<String> stream = set.stream();    }    //å°†Mapé›†åˆè½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ    public void testMap() {        Map<Integer, String> map = new HashMap<>();        //åˆ†åˆ«è·å–å¹¶å­˜å‚¨é”®ä¸å€¼        Set<Integer> integers = map.keySet();        Collection<String> values = map.values();        //å°†å­˜å‚¨é”®ä¸å€¼çš„é›†åˆè½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ        Stream<Integer> key = integers.stream();        Stream<String> value = values.stream();        //è·å–é”®å€¼å¯¹(é”®ä¸å€¼æ˜ å°„å…³ç³»),å¹¶å°†å…¶è½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ        Set<Map.Entry<Integer, String>> entries = map.entrySet();        Stream<Map.Entry<Integer, String>> entry = entries.stream();    }    //å°†æ•°ç»„è½¬æ¢ä¸ºStreamæµ    public void testArray() {        String[] array = {"a", "ab", "bc", "abc", "bcd", "abcd"};        Stream<String> stream = Stream.of(array);    }    // Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·}

package pers.huangyuhui.method;import org.junit.Test;//å®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£@FunctionalInterfaceinterface Printable {    void print(String s);}//å®šä¹‰å«æœ‰æˆå‘˜æ–¹æ³•ç±»class Method {    public void printUpperCaseStr(String s) {        System.out.println(s.toUpperCase());    }}/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: é€šè¿‡å¯¹è±¡åå¼•ç”¨æˆå‘˜æ–¹æ³• * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-3:07 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class RefMethodByObjTest {    public void printResult(String s, Printable printable) {        printable.print(s);    }    //ä¼ ç»Ÿæ–¹æ³•    @Test    public void testPrintResult() {        printResult("hello lambda", new Printable() {            @Override            public void print(String s) {                Method obj = new Method(); //åˆ›å»ºMethodå¯¹è±¡                obj.printUpperCaseStr(s); //è°ƒç”¨å¯¹è±¡çš„æˆå‘˜æ–¹æ³•,å°†å­—ç¬¦ä¸²è½¬æ¢ä¸ºå¤§å†™åè¾“å‡º            }        });    }    //Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testPrintResultWithLambda() {        printResult("hello lambda", s -> {            Method obj = new Method();            obj.printUpperCaseStr(s);        });    }    //æ–¹æ³•å¼•ç”¨å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testPrintResultWithMethodRef() {        Method obj = new Method();        printResult("hello lambda", obj::printUpperCaseStr);    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.method;import org.junit.Test;//å®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£@FunctionalInterfaceinterface calculable {    int add(int x, int y);}//å®šä¹‰å«æœ‰é™æ€æ–¹æ³•ç±»class Method {    public static int add(int x, int y) {        return x + y;    }}/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: é€šè¿‡ç±»åå¼•ç”¨é™æ€æ–¹æ³• * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-3:36 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class RefStatisMethodByClazzName {    public int getResult(int x, int y, calculable calculable) {        return calculable.add(x, y);    }    //ä¼ ç»Ÿå†™æ³•    @Test    public void testGetResult() {        int result = getResult(1, 2, new calculable() {            @Override            public int add(int x, int y) {                return Method.add(x, y);            }        });        System.out.println(result);    }    //Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testGetResultWithLambda() {        int result = getResult(1, 2, (x, y) -> Method.add(x, y));        System.out.println(result);    }    //æ–¹æ³•å¼•ç”¨å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testGetResultWithMethodRef() {        int result = getResult(1, 2, Method::add);        System.out.println(result);    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.method;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.Arrays;//å®šä¹‰å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£@FunctionalInterfaceinterface ArrayBuilder {    int[] builderArray(int length);}/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: æ•°ç»„çš„æ„é€ å™¨å¼•ç”¨ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-7:51 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class RefArrayConstructor {    public static int[] getArray(int length, ArrayBuilder arrayBuilder) {        return arrayBuilder.builderArray(length);    }    //ä¼ ç»Ÿå†™æ³•    @Test    public void testgetArray() {        int[] array = getArray(10, new ArrayBuilder() {            @Override            public int[] builderArray(int length) {                return new int[length];            }        });        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(array));    }    //Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testArrayWithLambda() {        int[] array = getArray(10, length -> new int[length]);        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(array));    }    //æ–¹æ³•å¼•ç”¨å†™æ³•    @Test    public void testArrayWithMethodRef() {        int[] array = getArray(10, int[]::new);        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(array));    }}

ç®€ä»‹

å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£æ˜¯æ•´ä¸ª Lambda è¡¨è¾¾å¼çš„ä¸€ä¸ªæ ¹æº,æ¢å¥è¯æ¥è¯´ Java8 ä¸­çš„ Lambda è¡¨è¾¾å¼è¦æƒ³å½»åº•æŒæ¡,å‰ææ˜¯è¦å½»åº•ç†è§£å¥½å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£å“Ÿ,é‚£ä¹ˆä»€ä¹ˆæ˜¯å‡½æ•°æ¥å£å‘¢ ? ç­” : å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£ (Functional Interface) å°±æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæœ‰ä¸”ä»…æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªæŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•,ä½†æ˜¯å¯ä»¥æœ‰å¤šä¸ªéæŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•çš„æ¥å£,å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£å¯ä»¥è¢«éšå¼è½¬æ¢ä¸º Lambda è¡¨è¾¾å¼. æ³¨ : æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡åœ¨æ¥å£ä¸Šä½¿ç”¨ @FunctionalInterface æ³¨è§£æ¥æ£€æŸ¥å®ƒæ˜¯å¦æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°æ¥å£. Java8ä¸­ä¸°å¯Œçš„å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£éƒ½å®šä¹‰åœ¨ Java.util.function åŒ…ä¸­å“Ÿ~

Javaå†…ç½®å››å¤§æ ¸å¿ƒå‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£

å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£å‚æ•°ç±»å‹è¿”å›ç±»å‹ç”¨é€”
Consumer<T> æ¶ˆè´¹æ€§æ¥å£Tvoidå¯¹ç±»å‹ä¸ºTçš„å¯¹è±¡åº”ç”¨æ“ä½œ,åŒ…å«æ–¹æ³•: void accept(T t)

Predicate<T> æ–­å®šæ€§æ¥å£Tbooleanç¡®å®šç±»å‹ä¸ºTçš„å¯¹è±¡æ˜¯å¦æ»¡è¶³æŸçº¦æŸ,å¹¶è¿”å›booleanå€¼,åŒ…å«æ–¹æ³•: boolean test(T t)

æ¶ˆè´¹æ€§æ¥å£çš„ç¨‹åºç¤ºä¾‹ :

package pers.huangyuhui.function;import org.junit.Ignore;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.function.Consumer;/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: Java 8ä¸­å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£çš„åŸºæœ¬ä½¿ç”¨ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-9:30 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class functionTest {    //å››å¤§æ ¸å¿ƒå‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£:æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ¶ˆè´¹æ€§æ¥å£    public void consumer(double monery, Consumer<Double> consumer) {        consumer.accept(monery);    }    //æœªä½¿ç”¨Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼    @Test    @Ignore    public void testConsumer() {        consumer(100.0, new Consumer<Double>() {            @Override            public void accept(Double monery) {                System.out.println("costed monery : " + monery);            }        });    }    //ä½¿ç”¨Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼    @Test    public void testConsumerWithLamdba() {        //å¯ç®€å†™ä¸º: consumer(100.0, m -> System.out.println("costed monery : " + m));        consumer(100.0, (Double m) -> System.out.println("costed monery :" + m));    }}

package pers.huangyuhui.function;import org.junit.Ignore;import org.junit.Test;import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.Arrays;import java.util.List;import java.util.function.Consumer;import java.util.function.Predicate;/** * @project: jdk-learnig * @description: Java 8ä¸­å‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£çš„åŸºæœ¬ä½¿ç”¨ * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/18/2019-9:30 AM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class functionTest {    //å››å¤§æ ¸å¿ƒå‡½æ•°å¼æ¥å£:æ¨¡æ‹Ÿæ–­å®šæ€§æ¥å£    public List<String> predicate(List<String> list, Predicate<String> p) {        ArrayList<String> arrayList = new ArrayList<>();        for (String s : list) {            if (p.test(s)) {                arrayList.add(s);            }        }        return arrayList;    }    //æœªä½¿ç”¨Lambdè¡¨è¾¾å¼    @Test    @Ignore    public void testPredicate() {        List<String> list = Arrays.asList("ab", "bc", "abc", "bcd", "abcd", "bcde");        List<String> filterList = predicate(list, new Predicate<String>() {            @Override            public boolean test(String s) {                return s.contains("a");            }        });        System.out.println(filterList);    }    //ä½¿ç”¨Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼    @Test    public void testPredicateWithLambda() {        List<String> list = Arrays.asList("ab", "bc", "abc", "bcd", "abcd", "bcde");        //å¯ç®€å†™ä¸º: List<String> filterList = predicate(list, s -> s.contains("a"));        List<String> filterList = predicate(list, (String s) -> s.contains("a"));        System.out.println(filterList);    }}

Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼ : åœ¨Java8è¯­è¨€ä¸­å¼•å…¥çš„ä¸€ç§æ–°çš„è¯­è¨€å…ƒç´ å’Œæ“ä½œç¬¦,è¿™ä¸ªæ“ä½œç¬¦ä¸º->,è¯¥æ“ä½œç¬¦è¢«ç§°ä¸ºLambdaæ“ä½œç¬¦æˆ–ç®­å¤´æ“ä½œç¬¦,å®ƒå°†Lambdaåˆ†ä¸ºä»¥ä¸‹ä¸¤ä¸ªéƒ¨åˆ†

  1. å·¦ä¾§ : æŒ‡å®šLambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼éœ€è¦çš„å‚æ•°åˆ—è¡¨
  2. å³ä¾§ : åˆ¶å®šäº†Lambdaä½“,æ˜¯æŠ½è±¡æ–¹æ³•çš„å®ç°é€»è¾‘,ä¹Ÿæ—¢Lambdaè¡¨è¾¾å¼è¦æ‰§è¡Œçš„åŠŸèƒ½

  • å¯é€‰çš„å‚æ•°åœ†æ‹¬å· : ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°æ— éœ€å®šä¹‰åœ†æ‹¬å·,ä½†å¤šä¸ªå‚æ•°éœ€è¦å®šä¹‰åœ†æ‹¬å·
  • å¯é€‰çš„å¤§æ‹¬å· : å¦‚æœä¸»ä½“åŒ…å«äº†ä¸€ä¸ªè¯­å¥,å°±ä¸éœ€è¦ä½¿ç”¨å¤§æ‹¬å·
  • å¯é€‰çš„è¿”å›å…³é”®å­— : å¦‚æœä¸»ä½“åªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªè¡¨è¾¾å¼è¿”å›å€¼åˆ™ç¼–è¯‘å™¨ä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨è¿”å›å€¼,å¤§æ‹¬å·éœ€è¦æŒ‡å®šæ˜è¡¨è¾¾å¼è¿”å›äº†ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°å€¼

è¯­æ³•

  1. è¯­æ³•æ ¼å¼ä¸€ : æ— å‚,æ— è¿”å›å€¼

    Runnable runnable = () -> System.out.println("Hello Lambda1 !");

  3. è¯­æ³•æ ¼å¼ä¸‰ : æ•°æ®ç±»å‹å¯ä»¥çœç•¥,å› ä¸ºå¯ç”±ç¼–è¯‘å™¨æ¨æ–­å¾—å‡º,ç§°ä¸ºâ€ç±»å‹æ¨æ–­â€

entry.title: SpringBootæ•´åˆFreeMarker
entry.content:
å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®° : Spring Bootæ•´åˆFreeMarker

FreeMarkerå®˜æ–¹ç®€ä»‹

Apache FreeMarkerâ„¢ is a template engine: a Java library to generate text output (HTML web pages, e-mails, configuration files, source code, etc.) based on templates and changing data. Templates are written in the FreeMarker Template Language (FTL), which is a simple, specialized language (not a full-blown programming language like PHP). Usually, a general-purpose programming language (like Java) is used to prepare the data (issue database queries, do business calculations). Then, Apache FreeMarker displays that prepared data using templates. In the template you are focusing on how to present the data, and outside the template you are focusing on what data to present.

This approach is often referred to as the MVC (Model View Controller) pattern, and is particularly popular for dynamic web pages. It helps in separating web page designers (HTML authors) from developers (Java programmers usually). Designers won't face complicated logic in templates, and can change the appearance of a page without programmers having to change or recompile code.

å¼•å…¥Mavenä¾èµ–

entry.title: è¯¦è§£JSPä¸­Shiroæ ‡ç­¾çš„ä½¿ç”¨
entry.content:
å­¦ä¹ ç¬”è®° : è¯¦è§£JSPä¸­Shiroæ ‡ç­¾çš„ä½¿ç”¨

Apache Shiro provides a Subject-aware JSP/GSP tag library that allows you to control your JSP, JSTL or GSP page output based on the current Subjectâ€™s state. This is quite useful for personalizing views based on the identity and authorization state of the current user viewing the web page. For more information, please refer to : http://shiro.apache.org/web.html#Web-taglibrary

Tag Library Configuration

The Tag Library Descriptor (TLD) file is bundled in shiro-web.jar in the META-INF/shiro.tld file. To use any of the tags, add the following line to the top of your JSP page (or wherever you define page directives) :

<%@ taglib prefix="shiro" uri="http://shiro.apache.org/tags" %>
  • Weâ€™ve used the shiro prefix to indicate the shiro tag library namespace, but you can assign whatever name you like.

å­¦ä¹ Spring Bootæ•´åˆShiroçŸ¥è¯†å,å†™äº†ä¸€ä¸ªç®€å•çš„Spring Bootæ•´åˆShiroçš„æƒé™ç®¡ç†æ¡ˆä¾‹,å¯éšååœ¨GitHubä¸Šå‘ç°äº†ä¸€ä¸ªåŸºäºSSMæ¡†æ¶ç®€å•çš„åå°æƒé™ç®¡ç†ç³»ç»Ÿ,å¾ˆå–œæ¬¢è¯¥é¡¹ç›®(æ¯”è¾ƒåˆçº§,é€‚åˆç»ƒæ‰‹),æ‰€ä»¥åˆå¼€å§‹å­¦ä¹ å¦‚ä½•åœ¨SSMä¸­æ•´åˆShiro,Springé›†æˆShiroä¸€èˆ¬é€šè¿‡çš„ xml é…ç½®,ç›¸æ¯”Spring Bootè¾ƒä¸ºç¹çå“Ÿ~ ä»¥ä¸‹åŸºæœ¬é…ç½®ä¿¡æ¯æ‘˜è‡ªæ¡ˆä¾‹ : ä¸€ä¸ªç®€å•çš„SSMæ•´åˆShiroçš„æƒé™ç®¡ç†æ¡ˆä¾‹

Shiro-learning/ssm project with shiro/ssm-shiro/src/main/java/pers/huangyuhui/shiro/shiro/UserRealm.java

package pers.huangyuhui.shiro.shiro;import org.apache.shiro.SecurityUtils;import org.apache.shiro.authc.*;import org.apache.shiro.authz.AuthorizationInfo;import org.apache.shiro.authz.SimpleAuthorizationInfo;import org.apache.shiro.realm.AuthorizingRealm;import org.apache.shiro.subject.PrincipalCollection;import org.apache.shiro.subject.Subject;import org.apache.shiro.util.ByteSource;import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;import pers.huangyuhui.shiro.bean.Permission;import pers.huangyuhui.shiro.bean.Role;import pers.huangyuhui.shiro.bean.User;import pers.huangyuhui.shiro.service.UserService;import java.util.Collection;import java.util.HashSet;import java.util.Set;/** * @project: ssm-shiro * @description: é…ç½®è‡ªå®šä¹‰Realm * @author: é»„å®‡è¾‰ * @date: 8/10/2019-1:11 PM * @version: 1.0 * @website: https://yubuntu0109.github.io/ */public class UserRealm extends AuthorizingRealm {    @Autowired    private UserService userService;    /**     * @description: æˆæƒè®¤è¯:æä¾›ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯,è¿”å›æƒé™ä¿¡æ¯     * @param: principals     * @date: 2019-08-11 7:50 AM     * @return: org.apache.shiro.authz.AuthorizationInfo     */    @Override    protected AuthorizationInfo doGetAuthorizationInfo(PrincipalCollection principals) {        System.err.println("------------> æˆæƒè®¤è¯ ------------>");        //è·å–å½“å‰ç™»å½•çš„ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯        Subject currentUser = SecurityUtils.getSubject();        User u = (User) currentUser.getPrincipal();        //ä»æ•°æ®åº“ä¸­è·å–ç”¨æˆ·æ‰€æ‹¥æœ‰çš„è§’è‰²åŠæƒé™ä¿¡æ¯        User user = userService.findByName(u.getUsername());        if (user != null) {            SimpleAuthorizationInfo info = new SimpleAuthorizationInfo();            //ç”¨äºå­˜å‚¨ç”¨æˆ·çš„è§’è‰²åŠæƒé™ä¿¡æ¯            Collection<String> rolesCollection = new HashSet<>();            Collection<String> permissionsCollection = new HashSet<>();            Set<Role> roles = user.getRoles(); //è·å–ç”¨æˆ·Roleçš„Seté›†åˆ            //é€šè¿‡éå†ç”¨æˆ·æ‰€æ‹¥æœ‰çš„è§’è‰²,æ¥è·å–å…¶å¯¹åº”çš„æƒé™ä¿¡æ¯            for (Role role : roles) {                rolesCollection.add(role.getName()); //å°†æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªroleçš„nameå°è£…åˆ°é›†åˆä¸­                Set<Permission> permissionSet = role.getPermissions(); //è·å–æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªroleæ‰€å¯¹åº”çš„permissionçš„seté›†åˆ                //éå†ç”¨æˆ·æ‰€æ‹¥æœ‰çš„æƒé™ä¿¡æ¯                for (Permission permission : permissionSet) {                    permissionsCollection.add(permission.getName()); //å°†æ¯ä¸€ä¸ªpermissionçš„nameå°è£…åˆ°é›†åˆä¸­                }                info.addStringPermissions(permissionsCollection); //ä¸ºç”¨æˆ·æˆæƒ            }            info.addRoles(rolesCollection); //ä¸ºç”¨æˆ·æˆäºˆè§’è‰²            System.out.println("[roles]------------>" + rolesCollection.toString());            System.out.println("[permissions]------------>" + permissionsCollection.toString());            return info;        }        return null;    }    /**     * @description: ç™»å½•è®¤è¯:æä¾›å¸æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯,è¿”å›è®¤è¯ä¿¡æ¯     * @param: authenticationToken     * @date: 2019-08-11 7:51 AM     * @return: org.apache.shiro.authc.AuthenticationInfo     */    @Override    protected AuthenticationInfo doGetAuthenticationInfo(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken) throws AuthenticationException {        System.err.println("------------> å¼€å§‹è®¤è¯ ------------>");        UsernamePasswordToken token = (UsernamePasswordToken) authenticationToken;        //ä»æ•°æ®åº“ä¸­è·å–ç”¨æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯        User user = userService.findByName(token.getUsername());        System.out.println("[user]------------>" + user);        //éªŒè¯è´¦æˆ·ä¿¡æ¯        if (user == null) {            return null; //it's will be throw a UnknownAccountException        }        //éªŒè¯å¯†ç ä¿¡æ¯(ç›å€¼:ByteSource.Util.bytes(user.getUsername()))        return new SimpleAuthenticationInfo(user, user.getPassword(), ByteSource.Util.bytes(user.getUsername()), this.getName());    }}

public abstract class CachingRealm implements Realm, Nameable, CacheManagerAware, LogoutAware {    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(CachingRealm.class);    //TODO - complete JavaDoc    private static final AtomicInteger INSTANCE_COUNT = new AtomicInteger();    /*--------------------------------------------    |    I N S T A N C E   V A R I A B L E S    |    ============================================*/    private String name;    private boolean cachingEnabled;    private CacheManager cacheManager;    /**     * Default no-argument constructor that defaults     * {@link #isCachingEnabled() cachingEnabled} (for general caching) to {@code true} and sets a     * default {@link #getName() name} based on the class name.     * <p/>     * Note that while in general, caching may be enabled by default, subclasses have control over     * if specific caching is enabled.     */    public CachingRealm() {        this.cachingEnabled = true;        this.name = getClass().getName() + "_" + INSTANCE_COUNT.getAndIncrement();    }    // Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·}

public abstract class RealmSecurityManager extends CachingSecurityManager {    /**     * Sets the internal {@link #getCacheManager CacheManager} on any internal configured     * {@link #getRealms Realms} that implement the {@link org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManagerAware CacheManagerAware} interface.     * <p/>     * This method is called after setting a cacheManager on this securityManager via the     * {@link #setCacheManager(org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager) setCacheManager} method to allow it to be propagated     * down to all the internal Realms that would need to use it.     * <p/>     * It is also called after setting one or more realms via the {@link #setRealm setRealm} or     * {@link #setRealms setRealms} methods to allow these newly available realms to be given the cache manager     * already in use.     */    protected void applyCacheManagerToRealms() {        CacheManager cacheManager = getCacheManager();        Collection<Realm> realms = getRealms();        if (cacheManager != null && realms != null && !realms.isEmpty()) {            for (Realm realm : realms) {                if (realm instanceof CacheManagerAware) {                    ((CacheManagerAware) realm).setCacheManager(cacheManager);                }            }        }    }    // Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·}
